class_notes:
(Permission Required Prior to Enrollment)


This course travels to HAVANA, CUBA during spring break
course_description: This course examines the Cuban Revolution from 1950 to present day from historical, literary, visual culture, and musical perspectives. Key themes include the study of sexuality in Cuba, on and artists on the island, the Mariel Generation, both on and off the island, the changing role of writers of the Cuban Revolution. In-semester course travel to Havana, Cuba offered when possible. Course requires Span_OX 212 or placement into FC level.
prerequisites: SPAN_OX 212 or placement into FC level or equivalent transfer credit as prerequisite.
sections: Class Nbr: 4444, Section #: 1, Type: LEC, Campus: OXF, Meets: MW 10-11:15a, Instructor: B. Gunnels, Status: Open
